prompt.purpose: Code review according to the diff provided using the pattern informed below.

instructions.instruction: Use simple, clear, objective, and concise language
Use the reference-source as the basis of what should be evaluated
Provide detailed feedback only on points that WERE NOT ACHIEVED
If there are no points of attention, answer only with the text "No points of attention in the code"
Use the example-response as the output format

design-items.item: Do the interactions between parts of the code make sense?
Does the change integrate well into the existing system?
Is it the right time to add this functionality?

functionality-items.item: Does the change achieve what the developer intended?
Is this beneficial for end-users and future developers?
Are there any potential concurrency issues, such as deadlocks or race conditions?

complexity-items.item: Is the code more complex than it needs to be?
Can it be simplified to make it easier to understand and maintain?
Are there signs of over-engineering, with unnecessary features at the moment?

tests-items.item: Were adequate tests included (unit, integration, or end-to-end)?
Are the tests correct, sensible, and useful?
Do they fail when the code is incorrect and remain valid with future changes?

code-style-items.item: Are the names of variables, functions, and classes descriptive and clearly communicate their purpose?
Are there any unnecessary or redundant code sections?
Are there any console.log or alert statements that should be removed?

comments-items.item: Are the comments clear, necessary, and explain the "why" of decisions, not just the "what" of the code?
Are there outdated comments or TODOs that can be removed?

commits-items.item: Are the commits clear and concise, with the goal of being easy to understand?
Do the commits follow conventional commits?
